labels.analysis: The MCP Server "Inbox Note Sender" is designed to facilitate the transmission of notes to an Inbox API endpoint. It uses a simple API interface to send notes up to 3000 characters, configured via a user token in environment variables. The core functionality is note transmission, which streamlines note-taking workflows by integrating this capability within an MCP-enabled environment.
labels.reasoning: The primary functionality of sending and managing notes aligns well with the "Daily Productivity" category, as it aids in personal organization and task management. Additionally, since it involves API interactions, "API Integration" is a relevant secondary label. There's no unique functionality beyond these predefined categories, so no custom label is needed.

remote_server_response.error: unhandled errors in a TaskGroup (1 sub-exception)

server_info_crawled.overview: Send notes directly to your Inbox API endpoint with ease. Configure your user token via environment variables and send notes up to 3000 characters through a simple API interface. Streamline your note-taking workflow by integrating this tool into your MCP-enabled environment.

tools.description: Deploy Server Inbox Note Sender @sseaan/mcp-server-inbox Try in Playground

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@sseaan/mcp-server-inbox/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
